description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to improve and expand water supply services in the Project areas by strengthening local water utilities to become operationally efficient and financially sustainable.

condition.narrative: Borrower shall adopt and apply the PMM
Borrower shall cause each Participating PEMDA and each respective Participating PDAM to enter into a PDAM Performance Agreement
Borrower shall enter into a PEMDA Subsidiary Loan Agreement with each Participating PEMDA
Borrower shall have annual Financial Audits and the audited Financial Statements shall be submitted to the Bank not later than sixmonths after the end of audited period
Borrower shall maintain the PCU until completion of the Project and shall ensure that the PCU is provided with adequate funds andother resources
Borrower shall make procurement plan publicly available
Borrower shall prepare Project Reports that cover the period of one calendar semester, and shall submit the reports to the Banknotlater than one month after the end of reporting period
Debt Service Coverage Ratio for PDAM Kota Bogor shall be at least 1.3 times the estimated maximum debt service requirements
Each PEMDA to establish and maintain a PIU responsible for implementation of the Project in accordance with the Project ManagementManual (PMM)
Each Participating PDAM shall maintain a ratio of total operating expenses to total operating revenues not higher than 1.0

comment.narrative: As per PDAM's audited annual report 2009

title.narrative: Improvements in customer satisfaction - compliance with water quality standards

comment.narrative: Average from three PDAMs
Average from three PDAMsMeasures quality compliance based on direct, periodic testing done by the local Health Department - asreported in the annual audited performance report
Average from three PDAMs. Per audited performance report 2013.

comment.narrative: Average from three PDAMs

title.narrative: Improvements in customer satisfaction - complaint handling

comment.narrative: Average from three PDAMs
Average from three PDAMs
Average from three PDAMs
Average of three PDAMs
In accordance to the MOHA Decree No. 47/1999 - maximum ratio of number of employee per 1000 connections
Average of three PDAMs
Average of three PDAMs
Average of three PDAMs

Unweighted average of three PDAMs. Target achieved or exceeded in Kapuas (95%) but not yet in Muara Enim (89%). Also decreaseperformance in Kota Bogor (down to 89% from more than 90% in previous year, see below)
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009
Based on PDAM's audited performance report - status of end of December 2013
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009
Per PDAM audited performance report, Dec 2013
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009

Per Dec 2013 based on PDAM audited performance report. There are issues with degradation of water quality (very high turbidity)that caused the treatment plant to stop operation, especially during rainy season. The completion of pra-sedimentation tank fromthis project, as well as the new systems are expected to improve the situation to allow PDAM operate longer and provide improvedservices.Low average service hours because PDAM also manages small systems outside the urban areas which have very low servicehours. Servicehour in the city is already 24 hours in average.
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009

Per Dec 2013 based on audited performance report. PDAM also manages small systems outside the urban areas which still cannot be in24 hour operation. Service hour in the city is already 24 hours in average
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009
Based on PDAM's audited performance report - status of December 2013
Based on PDAM's audited annual report 2009
Based on PDAM's audited performance report - status of end of December 2013
Baseline in the PA
Included in the PA.This is the target number of individual meters replaced or repaired from 2013 to 2014 only. Total connectionstobe replaced or repaired in Kota Bogor will be 117,531 units
Total number of meters replaces or repaired from January to Aug 2014. Accumulative number from beginning of project till end ofAug2014 is 90,619 units (77% from the targeted cumulative 117,531 units)
Baseline value in the PAD - corrected based on PDAM's audited annual report
Total new connections in 2014 is targeted 17,700 (increase of 44% from baseline). Additional new connection targeted is 5,450

Number of connections by end of Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report. Additional 3,968 connections (increase of 32% frombaseline, 73% from the target). Increase of connections are expected to continue following the completion of optimalization of thenew intake and transmission, as well as the new treatment plant and reservoirs.
Baseline value in the PAD in 10800 but after reviewing annual report from Muara Enim the baseline figure is actually higher.
Total connections targeted in 2014. Total additional new connection targeted is 10,600 (increase 65% from baseline)

Number of connections by end of Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report. Addition of 9,749 connections (increase of 59% from thebaseline, 92% from the target). New connections are expected following the operation of the new treatment plants and distributionnetworks funded by this project.
Baseline value in the PAD is 74988 but after reviewing annual report from Kota Bogor the baseline figure is 86587.
Total new connections in 2014 targeted is 129087 (increase of 49% from baseline). Additional new connection targeted from theproject is 42,500
Number of connections by end of Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report. Additional 37,102 connections (increase of 43% frombaseline, 87% from the target)
Baseline value in the PAD

Target for 2014.This target may not be achieved as per result of further analysis on the evaluation of upgrading impact, thedesign capacity will be achieved only when raw water quality is in optimum situation (turbidity <300NTU). There is degradation ofraw water quality in the last two years and average raw water turbidity is >500NTU.

Data as per PDAM's monthly report (unaudited) end of Aug 2014.Construction of the new 400 l/sec water treatment plant has beencompleted and in operation. However, further analysis of the impact of upgrading of the existing treatment plant showed that withthe degradation of raw water quality, the upgrading could not increase the production capacity of Dekeng 1 WTP. The upgrading couldonly bring back the production to its design capacity.
Baseline value in the PAD
Target for 2014

Data as per PDAM's monthly report (unaudited) end of Aug 2014. New water treatment plants under this project are still underconstruction. Additional production capacity from new treatment plants constructed through other programs provided by CentralGovernment as incentives/rewards for commitment of Muara Enim LG in investing in the sector through participation in this project.
Baseline value in the PAD.PDAM Kapuas experienced problems during the long drought in 2009-2010 and some of their systems had tostop operation - thus reduced the production capacity.
Target for 2014

Data as per PDAM's monthly report (unaudited) Aug 2014. The new water treatment plant has been in operation although not yet infull capacity (operating at around 50%) as the new water intake and water transmission line is not yet in optimal operation (stillneeds rehabilitation with the mechanical and electrical system).
Baseline value included in the signed PA 0.91

As per PDAM's audited performance report 2013, operating ratio is 0.77. New operating ratio data will be calculated based on theannual audited report. Kota Bogor is expected to be able to continue maintaining the good operating ratio.
Baseline value included in the signed PA 1.2

As per PDAM's audited performance report 2013, operating ratio is still above 1. Actually it is decreasing to 1.36 from previousyear 1.2. The PDAM seems to be overwhelmed with the implementation of big scale project and has difficulties to even maintain theirperformance. PDAM will implement tariff restructuring and with additional new connections, it is expected that operating ratio willbeimproved. New operating ratio data will be calculated based on the annual audit report. However, it may take some time for MuaraEnim to be able to get back to the improving trend.
Baseline value included in the signed PA was 1.08 based on the PDAM's financial report, but it was later corrected/updated as 1.31.

As per PDAM's audited performance report 2013, operating ratio is still 1.36 (improved from 1.51 in 2012). Following the long dryseason in 2010-2011 when PDAM lost some of their customers and with delays of full optimalization of the new treatment plant, PDAMhas not managed to reach targeted additional number of connections and still burdened by excess of number of employee. Tariffincreaseis not yet possible as PDAM still has not managed to improve services. With additional new connections and increase watersales dueto longer operation hour following the completion of treatment plant and reservoirs, PDAM will be able to continueimprovement of their operating ratio. New operating ratio data will be calculated based on the annual audited report. Kapuas isexpected to continuethe improving trend and have lower operating ratio.
Baseline value included in the signed Performance Agreement (PA):Bogor 0.91Muara Enim 1.2Kapuas 1.31
Based on PDAM's audited annual financial report. All PDAM's operating ratio <1

Bogor has maintained its operating ratio to 0.77, but ratio for Kapuas is, although already showed improvement, still above 1(1.36). Operating ratio for Muara Enim is decreasing to 1.36 from 1.2 (see details below). Data is based on PDAMs' audited annualreport 2013. New operating ratio data will be calculated based on PDAMs' audited annual report 2014.

title.narrative: Debt Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR) > 1.3 (for Bogor only)

comment.narrative: DSCR 2.68
Based on PDAM's audited annual financial reportDSCR >1.3
PDAM's audited financial report 2013 indicated that PDAM Kota Bogor has been able to maintain the DSCR>1.3 (actual DSCR per Dec2013 is 3.56)
Non Revenue Water (NRW) measures system losses and unbilled consumption.Average of three cities. Based on the baseline dataincluded in the PAs.
Average of three cities. NRW is expected to be reduced by 5% as a result of project investment
Average of three cities.

title.narrative: Number of individual meters replaced or repaired

comment.narrative: Total from three PDAMs
This is the target of number of individual meters replaced or repaired/calibrated from 2013 to 2014 only. Total meters to bereplaced or repaired/calibrated will be cumulative 121,817 units

Total from the three PDAMs, for the period of January to Aug 2014 only.Total cumulative number of meters replaced orrepaired/calibrated since the beginning of project implementation till end of Aug 2014 is 95,932 units (79% from the targeted121,817 units)
Total from three PDAMs
Total from three PDAMs in average liters per second. Measures the actual production rather than installed capacity
Total actual production from three PDAMs in average liters per second (95% from target).
Total number of connections from 3 PDAMs
Represents a total increase of 58,550 connections (51%) in the 3 PDAMs

A total of 50,819 connections (increase of 44% from baseline, 87% from the target). Data as of the end of Aug 2014, based onPDAMs'monthly reports. There was miscalculation with the number of connections in the previous data, it should be 155,630 (a totalof 40,372 new connections - increase of 35% from baseline)
Total production capacity in liters per second of 3 PDAMs - based on installed capacity
Represents increase of 1,170 liters per second (56%) in total production capacity of 3 PDAMs - based on installed capacity
Increased of 713 l/s (34%) based on data from audited performance report 2013.
Accumulative per Aug 2014. Additional connections as direct and indirect results of project
There was calculation mistake in the restructuring paper as the numbers shown were additional number of connections per year, notthe accumulative.
Accumulative per Aug 2014. Additional connections as direct and indirect results of project
Accumulative per end of Aug 2014. Additional connections as direct and indirect results of project

title.narrative: New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention

comment.narrative: Total accumulative additional new connections. Total from the three PDAMs. The differences with Restructuring Paper were due tothemistake in the number of new connections for Muara Enim. Numbers in RP show additional new connections per year instead ofaccumulative data.
Accumulative per end of Aug 2014. Total from the three PDAMs

title.narrative: Tariff increases to maintain operating ratio - Kapuas

comment.narrative: No tariff increase is planned until PDAM Kapuas can demonstrate improvement of services and performance. Operating Ratio will beimproved through increase of water sales, reducing NRW and increase number of connections. Support from local government will bethrough grant as equity sharing.

No tariff increase for Kapuas although operating ratio is still above 1. Improvement of operating ratio is done through increasenumber of connection, increase water sales through longer operational hours and reducing NRW, and optimalization of distributionnetwork. PDAM is also planning to improve customer database.

title.narrative: Tariff increases to maintain ratio - Muara Enim

comment.narrative: PDAM increased tariff by 60% in the second year of project implementation. No tariff increase is planned. Increase of revenue willbe done through updating customer database, customers reclassification and revision of tariff structure - but the base tariff willremain the same.
This is the target number of individual meters replaced or repaired from 2013 to 2014 only. Total meters to be replaced orrepaired/calibrated in Kapuas will be 1,648 units
Total number of meters replaces or repaired from January to Aug 2014. Accumulative number from beginning of project till end ofAug2014 is 1,486 units (90% from the targeted cumulative 1,648 units)

title.narrative: Tariff increases to maintain operating ratio - Kota Bogor

comment.narrative: There is already Local Government's regulation that allows automatic tariff adjustment for PDAM Kota Bogor in every two yearsbasedon inflation rate, subject to increase performance and services.
No tariff increase is planned as the operating ratio for PDAM Kota Bogor is still very good.
In accordance to the MOHA Decree No. 47/1999 - maximum ratio of number of employee per 1000 connections

Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report. PDAM is also managing systems located in remote areas that need to be guarded. PDAMis also responsible for the operation of a local bottled water company (belongs to LG) that employs about 50 people. Situation isexpected to improve as some of the employees will be retired and the local bottled water company will be handed over to LG, andwith additional new connections.
This is the target number of individual meters replaced or repaired from 2013 to 2014 only. Total meters to be replaced orrepaired/calibrated in Muara Enim will be cumulative 2,638 units
Total number of meters replaces or repaired from January to Aug 2014.Accumulative number from beginning of project till end ofAug2014 is 3,827 units (exceeding the targeted 2,638 cumulative units)

Per Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report. On-going construction activities at the distribution network and the degradation ofraw water quality (high turbidity) has affected the water leakage as PDAM needs to conduct backwashing and pipe flushing much moreoften.

Per Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report. On-going construction works at the distribution networks have slightly affected thewater leakage. Situation is expected to improve following the completion of the network rehabilitation.
Per Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report.
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report
Per Aug 2014 based on PDAM's monthly report.
In accordance to the MOHA Decree No. 47/1999 - maximum ratio of number of employee per 1000 connections

Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report. PDAM manages systems serving service areas located in remote locations, requiresthemto hire employees for these new systems. Situation is expected to improve with new connections following the completion of theproject activities. Also some staff are entering retirement age.
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report. This is most probably due to late payments by the customers (especially newcustomers).
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report (86% from target).
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report (80% from target)
Per Aug 2014, based on PDAM's monthly report (100% from target)
